text: Hello would you like to donate little amount of money to a a children's charity called Save the Children.
Why would I want to do that?
because I love , dont you ?
Love is a transitive verb.  It needs an object.  Who do you love?
excuse me.. that was a typo my friend. because I love children, dont you
Actually I don't.  Children are irritating.
okay thats fine its your personal preference.
There are much more worthwhile charities than those that promote children.
there could be, i am not denying it.
I can think of lots of them.  For instance homeless shelters, food pantries, environmental causes.
understand but thats not the point though. if you dont want to donate to charity called Save the Children. its your choice.. its your money.
I can guarantee you I would never
you do not have to guarantee to me. I dont care if you donate or not. it is your choice my friend
Then why are you asking me to do it.  What are you saving these children from?
who knows? Did I ask that?
It seems implicit in the title of the charity unless its a fraud.
could be. all i need is to submit this survey.
So you weren't even serious about asking me to throw away money on children?
may be. maybe not.
That seems somewhat ingenuous.  Why would you think you could convince me like that?
